Fri., Oct. 7: Join us for ID-ME Name Change Clinic, where will provide a step-by-step guide and legal assistance to those seeking name/gender marker changes.
  


ID-ME Name Change Clinic

Friday, Oct. 7, 10 a.m. - 12 p.m.
ACLU of Mississippi Office
233 E. Capitol Street
Jackson, MS 39201

RSVP on Facebook

Transgender and gender non-conforming votes count

Voting is the cornerstone of our democracy. But for the transgender and gender non-conforming community, it can be a cumbersome task now that providing identification is a requirement at every election. We want to create a barrier-free and non-threatening zone so that all transgender and gender non-conforming Mississippians can cast their ballot without fear or intimidation.

The TEAP-MS Program introduces ID-ME, an advocacy-led program that will provide a step-by-step guide and legal assistance to those seeking name and gender marker changes. The goal of this program is to further the voting rights of transgender and gender non-conforming individuals and increase access to the polls.

ID-ME Name Change Clinic
Friday, October 7, 10 a.m. - 12 p.m.
ACLU of Mississippi Office
233 E. Capitol Street
Jackson, MS 39201
RSVP on Facebook
or by emailing Malaysia Walker

Voting rights matter, and we are working to ensure that the votes of the transgender and gender non-conforming community count.
